definition: contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
clique/school/group/faction/to dispatch/to send/to assign/to appoint/pi (Greek letter Ππ)/the circular ratio pi = 3.1415926/(loanword) pie

sentences.english: and the central villain was the new figure of the public relations man.
sentences.chinese: 而重要的反派就是公共关系人的新形象。

sentences.english: The rebels defiantly welcomed new allies and laid plans for unionization campaigns.
sentences.chinese: 造反派热烈欢迎新盟友，并制订组织工会的计划。

sentences.english: The rebel factions made common cause to overthrow the regime.
sentences.chinese: 各造反派联合起来共同推翻政府。

sentences.english: Then the final showdown with the bad kung fu kids.
sentences.chinese: 然后结局定会和反派功夫小子一决胜负。
造反派战士和囚犯相互辉映。

sentences.english: The rebels occupied the post office.
Some bad guys have more fun than others.
sentences.chinese: 有些反派似乎比好人更为有趣。

sentences.english: The subjection of the rebels took a long time.
sentences.chinese: 征服这些造反派花了很长时间。

sentences.english: The 501st focuses on Star Wars villain costuming.
sentences.chinese: 五零一集中与星球大战的反派扮装。

sentences.english: Filmmaking is all about genres and having a strong antagonist.
sentences.chinese: 电影制作是有体裁的，都有强烈的反派角色。

sentences.english: US military helicopter has gone down northwest of Baghdad with Sunni insurgents tied to Al-Qaeda claiming responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 与阿尔盖达组织有联系的逊尼造反派称对其负责。

sentences.english: The leaders of the revolt made important changes.
sentences.chinese: 造反派的领导做出重要改变。

sentences.english: For instance, red for heroism, white for villainy .
sentences.chinese: 好比，红脸表英雄，白脸表反派。

sentences.english: At the center of plot was the bad guy the drug lord Han super villain Woo Manchu.
sentences.chinese: 影片中一个重要人物是毒枭韩先生，片中的最大反派。

definition: role/character in a novel/persona/also pr. [jiao3 se4]
supporting role (in play, film etc)/minor role/to play a secondary role (in business etc)/to play second fiddle
scene (in a movie etc)/one's part in a movie or play/(archaic) actor's payment
to develop/to evolve/to practice/to perform/to play/to act
(of an actor) to bring (one's character) to life/to act brilliantly
see 領盒飯|领盒饭[ling3 he2 fan4]
to appear (in a show etc)/an appearance (on stage etc)
to play the role of/to act
